orders

Class Order

  • java.lang.Object
    • orders.Order
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttackOrder, BlankOrder, BuildArmyOrder, BuildNavyOrder, ConvoyOrder, DefendOrder, DisbandOrder, MoveOrder, RetreatOrder, SupportOrder

    public abstract class Order
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains objects that are involved for an order of a unit. Orders include: move, attack, defend, support, convoy, build army, build navy, retreat, and disband.

      Fields

      Primarily used during the retreat phase.

      The current state of the Order.

      protected Unit unit
      The unit executing this Order.

    • Field Detail

      • currentTerritory

        protected Territory currentTerritory
        The initial territory of the Order. Selected first in the process of creating an Order.

      • destinationTerritory

        protected Territory destinationTerritory
        The destination of the command. Selected second in the process of creating an Order. Can be null for some orders.

      • command

        protected java.lang.String command
        Commands include: move, attack, defend, support, convoy, build army, build navy, retreat, and disband.

      • strength

        protected int strength
        The strength an attack, move, or defend order. Initialized at 1. Used during adjudication to see if one of those 3 moves failed or passed. If the order is supported it will be incremented by one for each supporting unit.

      • state

        protected int state
        The current state of the Order. Primarily used during adjudication. Check the static int fields for descriptions of each.

      • unit

        protected Unit unit
        The unit executing this Order.

      • NOT_CHECKED

        public static final int NOT_CHECKED
        Initial state of all Orders.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHECKED_WAITING

        public static final int CHECKED_WAITING
        After the syntax of the Order is checked during adjudication, it will set to this state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FAILED

        public static final int FAILED
        Order is set to this state if it fails any of the checks during adjudication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PASSED

        public static final int PASSED
        Once adjudication is complete, all orders that do not have a state of FAILED are set to this state. An Order is only executed if it has a state of PASSED at the end of adjudication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FOLLOWING

        public static final int FOLLOWING
        Used if an attack/move order is following another attack/move Order.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DONE

        public static final int DONE
        Primarily used during the retreat phase. If a retreat/disband is not necessary for a unit, the Order state is set to DONE so it will be skipped.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHECKER

        public static final int CHECKER
        Primarily used for resolving move/attack/retreat conflicts. If a valid Order is determined to have a move conflict which causes it to fail, the Order state is set to CHECKER. This is so other Orders are still compared to this order when resolving conflicts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHECKING

        public static final int CHECKING
        Used for solving the revolving 3+ unit move problem. If a unit is moving/attacking another unit which is also moving, it is set to this state. So if that unit is also moving into another territory with a unit that is moving into the first there will not be an endless loop.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Order

        public Order(Territory t)
        Constructor for a new Order. Sets the unit to the input Territory's unit so potentially the unit could be null.
        Parameters:
        t - the starting Territory

    • Method Detail

      • setState

        public void setState(int i)
        Sets the state of the Order. Ideally one will use the static int fields of this class as input.
        Parameters:
        i - the state of the Order

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Adds the order to the game's current Turn so it may be adjudicated there.

      • getCommand

        public java.lang.String getCommand()
        Gets the String value of the command. Commands include: move, attack, defend, support, convoy, build army, build navy, retreat, and disband.
        Returns:
        the command

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()
        Gets the strength of an attack, move, or defend Order.
        Returns:
        the strength

      • getStartingTerritory

        public Territory getStartingTerritory()
        Gets the Territory where the Order was initialized.
        Returns:
        the starting Territory

      • getDestinationTerritory

        public Territory getDestinationTerritory()
        Gets the Territory where the command will be acted upon.
        Returns:
        the destination Territory

      • incrementStrength

        public void incrementStrength()
        Increments the int value of strength by one.

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Gets the state of the Order as an int.
        Returns:
        the state

        public void setCommand(java.lang.String c)
        Sets the command.
        Parameters:
        c - the new command

      • setDestinationTerritory

        public void setDestinationTerritory(Territory t)
        Sets the Territory where the order will be acted upon.
        Parameters:
        t - the Territory

      • isCommandEqual

        public boolean isCommandEqual(java.lang.String command)
        Checks if the input String is equal to the command field.
        Parameters:
        command - the command
        Returns:
        true, if input is equal to the command.

      • isAdjacent

        public boolean isAdjacent()
        Checks if the starting Territory is adjacent to the destination Territory.
        Returns:
        true, if territories are adjacent

      • isValidOrder

        public abstract boolean isValidOrder()
        Checks if this is a valid Order. Typically it will be through syntax but there are special cases.
        Returns:
        true, if this is a valid order

      • addAdditionalTerritory

        public abstract void addAdditionalTerritory(Territory t)
        Adds an additional Territory to the special case Orders. For others this method will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        t - the Territory to be added.

      • toShortString

        public abstract java.lang.String toShortString()
        For displaying the Order in few characters to display it on the sidebar.
        Returns:
        the Order as a short String

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
        int x,
        int y)
        Used to draw this Order to the current Order section of the sidebar.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics to draw this order.
        x - the x coordinate of the location to draw this Order.
        y - the y coordinate of the location to draw this Order.

      • setUnitOrder

        public void setUnitOrder()
        Sets the unit's order as this one.

      • getUnit

        public Unit getUnit()
        Gets the unit.
        Returns:
        the unit
